spell.name: Calm Undead
spell.classes: School: Necromancy, Bard, Cleric, Paladin, Warlock
spell.text:
This spell soothes and quiets undead, bathing them in a soft cerulean light that emanates from the caster, rendering them docile and harmless. Only mindless undead or those with Intelligence score of 2 or less can be affected by this spell. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, becoming incapacitated on a failed save. Any threat breaks the spell on the threatened undead, who return to their previous behavior when the spell ends.
At Higher Level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional target for each slot above 1st.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 320 (Third Party)

spell.name: Carnivorous Mushroom
spell.compontents: V, S, M (drops of blood from two different types of creatures)
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard, Artificer
spell.text:
A mushroom you touch grows teeth and a carnivorous appetite, gaining a bite attack that deals 2d8 piercing damage and the target is grappled. At the beginning of each of the target's turns, it can attempt a Dexterity saving throw to escape. The mushroom automatically hits with its bite attack against a creature it has grappled.
If this spell is cast on a fungoid creature, such as a funglet or vegepygmy, it can make a bite attack as a bonus action once per round.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 320 (Third Party)

spell.name: Dancing Shade
spell.compontents: V, S, M (a piece of gold string and your own shadow)
spell.classes: School: Abjuration, Bard, Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
As you cast this spell, you animate your shadow to shield you from harm. Your dancing shade can absorb damage up to your current hit points before disappearing. This protection extends to physical attacks as well as spells and effects that deal radiant and lightning damage. When the shadow absorbs the maximum amount of hit points possible, it dissipates, leaving you without a shadow until you complete a short rest.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 320 (Third Party)

spell.name: Degenerate
spell.compontents: V, S, M (a petition focus and unholy water)
spell.classes: School: Necromancy, Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You touch a creature and stimulate its natural aging processes. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target loses up to 36 (8d8) hit points; if the target would be reduced to 0 hit points, they instead have 1 hit point. For the duration of the spell, the target loses 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns (10 hit points each minute) and it gains no benefit from resting.
The target's appendages (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, rot and fall away after 10 minutes. If you keep the rotted part and hold it to the stump at the spell end, it instantaneously causes the main body of the affected creature to become poisoned for 24 hours.
The spell can also be ended by heal (as a 7th-level spell) or more powerful magic.
Poisoned: • A poisoned creature has disadvantage on Attack rolls and Ability Checks.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 320 (Third Party)

spell.name: Fiber Shape
spell.classes: Ritual Caster, , Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard, Fighter (Eldritch Knight), Rogue (Arcane Trickster), Artificer
spell.text:
You form a mound of mold, moss, or mushroom into any shape that suits your purpose. While it is possible to make crude coffers, doors, and so forth, fine detail isn't possible. There is a 30% chance that any shape that includes moving parts simply doesn't work.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 320 (Third Party)

spell.name: Form of Shadow
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Fighter (Eldritch Knight), Rogue (Arcane Trickster), Artificer
spell.text:
You suffuse yourself with shadow essence, which bestows upon you the amorphous trait: you can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing. Additionally, while under the effects of this spell and in dim light or darkness, you can Hide as a bonus action.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 320 (Third Party)

spell.name: Fungal Infestation
spell.classes: School: Necromancy, Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Warlock
spell.text:
The touch of your fungus-wreathed hands coats the target in necrotic fungus that makes its flesh soft and fragile. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 necrotic damage as toadstools, ringworm, and other disgusting fungal growths sprout from its skin. Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as an action.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot above 3rd.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 321 (Third Party)

spell.name: Fungicide
spell.compontents: V, S, M (2 ft. of fungal liana)
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Warlock
spell.text:
You designate a point within range and Huge mushrooms sprout from the ground and attempt to consume any nearby sentient creatures. For the duration, these fungi turn the ground into difficult terrain. When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 6d6 bludgeoning damage and be restrained by the grasping fungi until the spell ends. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already restrained by the fungi takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage. A creature restrained by the fungi can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 321 (Third Party)

spell.name: Fungus Blight
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You touch a dead, restrained, unconscious or incapacitated creature. If the creature fails a Constitution saving throw, it instantly bursts open with 2d4 fungus leshy (and the victim now requires a true resurrection or wish spell to return from the dead). These fungus leshy are willing to do your bidding for the duration of the spell but gain free will when the effect ends.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 322 (Third Party)

spell.name: Ironfiber
spell.compontents: V, S, M (mushrooms roughly shaped like the intended object)
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Ritual Caster, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Wizard
spell.text:
You touch fungal material and transform it into ironfiber, a magical substance created by druids from normal plant matter. While remaining naturally fibrous in almost every way, ironfiber is as strong, heavy, and as resistant to fire as steel. Spells that affect metal or iron do not function on ironfiber. Spells that affect plants do affect ironfiber, although ironfiber does not burn. Using this spell with fiber shape or crafting, you can fashion fibrous items that function as metal items. Thus, fibrous plate armor and fibrous swords can be created that are as durable as their normal steel counterparts.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 322 (Third Party)

spell.name: Light of Knowledge
spell.compontents: V, S, M (gem valued at 40 gp or more)
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Ritual Caster, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Artificer
spell.text:
You and all other subjects in range gather together in a circle and meld minds, pooling your collective memories in a matrix that exchanges information at the speed of light. You may make a number of Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma-checks equal to the total number of subjects (minimum 2). You automatically benefit from the help action on these checks and are proficient in any skills a participant is proficient in. You also use the highest Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma modifier of the participants for these checks. There lies danger in this melding of minds—for each check you fail, you take 4d6 psychic damage, as your mind has trouble reconciling the massive influx of information and redistributing it among the participants.
Colliatur are uniquely suited for this type of information sharing—for each colliatur participating in this ritual beyond the first, reduce the psychic damage incurred on a failure by 1d6.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 322 (Third Party)

spell.name: Loom Large
spell.compontents: V, S, M (piece of glass, your own shadow)
spell.classes: School: Illusion, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Fighter (Eldritch Knight), Rogue (Arcane Trickster), Artificer
spell.text:
You absorb your own shadow into your body, causing you to be suffused by the intangible bulk of darkness. Your shadow-enhanced size doubles in all dimensions and increases your size by one category. For example, from Medium to Large.
If there isn't enough room for you to double your size, you instead attain the maximum possible size in the space available. Your dimensions continue to adjust to your surroundings. Note that, since the size increase is based on your shadow suffusing you, it does not actually increase your size and hence, does not hinder your progress through tight spaces. Until the spell ends, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. Your weapons also grow to match your seemingly new size. While thus enlarged, your attacks with them deal an extra 1d6 cold damage.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 322 (Third Party)

spell.name: Mass Inflict Wounds
spell.classes: School: Necromancy, Cleric
spell.text:
A wave of damaging energy washes out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each target takes 3d10 necrotic damage.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 322 (Third Party)

spell.name: Medicinal Mushrooms
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger
spell.text:
Up to ten mushrooms appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. A creature can use its action to eat one mushroom. Eating a mushroom restores 1 hit point, and the mushroom provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.
However, these caps are also hallucinogenic. If a creature willingly eats more than one of these caps in a given day, it is haunted by visions. The hallucinating creature suffers disadvantage to all Strength and Dexterity saving throws and skill checks and automatically fails all Wisdom saving throws.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 322 (Third Party)

spell.name: Mushroom Apotheosis
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Ritual Caster, Cleric, Druid
spell.text:
You speak the words of power, point at a target and from your hands, a massive, fungal forest springs forth, coating any floor, wall and similar surface within half a mile, instantly generating a new fungal forest; you have limited control over the development of this forest. The entire area becomes filled with mushrooms of all varieties. You may roll on the Mushroom Varieties table a number of times equal to your level to determine which mushroom dominate the spread of mushrooms created by this spell.
Mushroom Varieties: d100 | Common Name | Page 01-06 | Basidirond | 342 07-12 | Fountain of the God | 262 13-18 | Funneling Fungi | 255 19-24 | Glistening Saucer | 257 25-30 | Meaty Mushroom | 420 31-36 | Moon Child | 278 37-42 | Necroshroom | 265 43-48 | Peaceful Giant | 256 49-54 | Poison Pods | 270 55-60 | Poisonpuff | 418 61-66 | Shield Mushroom | 419 67-72 | Shriekers | 483 73-78 | Tiger Blood | 273 79-84 | Twilight Caps | 420 85-90 | Violet Fungi | 519 91-96 | Yellow Musk Creeper | 530 97-100 | caster’s choice | n/a
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 323 (Third Party)

spell.name: Mushroom Mount
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger
spell.text:
You enchant a benign, unintelligent mushroom of Large size or smaller; the fungus uproots itself and attaches to you. Wrapping rhizomorphs envelop your legs and you move as one. Your fused form moves along in short hops that allow you ignore difficult terrain and grants you a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. While fused to a mushroom mount you are immune to the prone condition.
When you are hit with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to cause the mushroom mount to expel a cloud of spores that momentarily muddles your assailant's senses: any additional attacks against you beyond the first from the same creature are made with disadvantage.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 323 (Third Party)

spell.name: Naraneus's Fangs
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Wizard
spell.text:
Glowing javelins of poison streak from your hand to four different points you can see within range, leaving vaporous trails of dark green mist that reek of burning skin in their wake. Each creature in a 40-foot radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 20d6 poison damage and 20d6 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one poisonous deluge is affected only once.
The spell leaves objects in the area poisoned and untouchable, including any items being worn or carried.
All creatures affected by the spell are poisoned for 1 round per point of poison damage taken. All items remain poisonous for 1 day or until washed clean.
Poisoned: • A poisoned creature has disadvantage on Attack rolls and Ability Checks.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 323 (Third Party)

spell.name: Peripheral Fungi
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Warlock
spell.text:
You grow miniature audire boletus around your ears. They instantly adapt to the contours of sound waves from where you are standing when the spell is cast, granting you blindsight with a reach of 10 feet. Whenever you move more than 5 feet in a given round, you lose this blindsight until you stand still for one round and let the fungi readjust.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you increase the range of your blindsight by 10 feet for each spell slot above 2nd.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 323 (Third Party)

spell.name: Revealing Insight
spell.compontents: V, S, M (a clear mental image of a creature you have seen firsthand, or something that once belonged to it that the spell consumes)
spell.classes: School: Divination, Ritual Caster, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Wizard
spell.text:
You learn the true name and current location of the creature you target. Nothing short of mind blank spell or assistance from a deity stops you from discovering the precise whereabouts of a single living or undead individual.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 323 (Third Party)

spell.name: Rhizomorph Road
spell.compontents: V, M (a paste of fungus spores and powdered gem dust worth 50 gp)
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Ritual Caster, Cleric
spell.text:
This spell creates a magical link between a Large or larger inanimate mushroom within range and another mushroom, at any distance, on the same plane of existence. For the duration, any creature can step into the target plant and exit from the destination plant by using 5 feet of movement.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 324 (Third Party)

spell.name: Searing Light
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Cleric, Paladin
spell.text:
Focusing divine power like a ray of the sun, you project a blast of light from your open palm. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 5d8 radiant damage. Creatures hit by this spell must succeed a Constitution saving throw or become blinded until the end of their next turn. Undead and creatures sensitive to bright light make this save with disadvantage.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 324 (Third Party)

spell.name: Shadow Cast
spell.compontents: V, S, M (scrap of block cloth)
spell.classes: School: Illusion, Bard, Cleric, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Fighter (Eldritch Knight), Rogue (Arcane Trickster), Artificer
spell.text:
You call forth an amorphous, 20-foot-sphere of black matter from the Plane of Shadow that you can direct toward any light source within range. You can cause this blob to change shape, creating moving shadows on nearby surfaces. These shadows can cause distraction and confusion, causing all viewers within the spell's radius to suffer disadvantage on all Wisdom (Perception) checks relying on sight. A creature can end the spell's effect for themselves at the end of each of its turns with a successful Wisdom saving throw.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 324 (Third Party)

spell.name: Shadow Mote
spell.classes: School: Illusion, Bard, Cleric, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Fighter (Eldritch Knight), Rogue (Arcane Trickster), Artificer
spell.text:
You create a small sphere of shadow-essence that you can hurl as a ranged spell attack at one target. On a hit, the sphere causes the target to see distracting movement out of the corner of their eye. This can have two possible effects; you decide which when the attack hits.
Distracting Shadows: The target sees movement amongst the shadows, making it harder to focus on any one thing. For one round, the target makes attacks with disadvantage and it cannot concentrate.
Threatening Shadows: The target sees threats that are not there, which lowers their defenses against threats that are. The next weapon attack against the target is made with advantage.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot above 1st. You must make a ranged spell attack for each target.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 324 (Third Party)

spell.name: Shadow Raising
spell.compontents: V, S, M (the finger of an intelligent humanoid, your own shadow)
spell.classes: School: Necromancy, Bard, Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You rip your shadow from your body and cast it into the body of a deceased creature in range that has not been dead for more than 5 minutes. The creature is animated by your shadow as a macabre puppet with the deceased being's full set of actions, abilities, feats and spells remaining when the creature died. The animated creature has half your hit points upon casting this spell, which also are the puppet's maximum hit points, and it takes its turn directly after your turn. You must use a reaction in order for the shadow puppet to use a reaction.
Since the animated puppet is powered in equal parts by fading life energy as well as your shadow, shadow raising only works for brief periods of time After a total of 20 minutes, the corpse collapses and your shadow reassembles and returns to you. If the shadow puppet is destroyed, you lose your shadow until you complete a short rest.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 324 (Third Party)

spell.name: Shadow Shackles
spell.compontents: V, S, M (a chunk of tungsten, your own shadow)
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Bard, Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
Your magic-infused shadow confines the target in shackles. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, your shadow anchors the target to the spot, reducing its speed to 0.
While held in place by the shackles, the target takes 3d6 cold damage at the start of each of its turns. Shadow shackles have an AC of 18, a damage threshold of 10 and 20 hit points. If the shackles are destroyed, the spell ends and you lose your shadow until you complete a short rest.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 325 (Third Party)

spell.name: Spores of Madness
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You exhale a cloud of spores in a 15-foot cone. The cloud moves away from you at 10 feet per round, rolling along the surface of the ground at the start of each of your turns in the same direction it last moved. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the cloud up to 10 feet and change its direction.
Spores of madness simultaneously replicates the effects of cloudkill and confusion. A creature exposed to the cloud must make both a Constitution and Wisdom saving throw to resist the respective effects of those spells.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 325 (Third Party)

spell.name: Umbral Step
spell.time: 1 reaction, which you take when you or an adjacent ally is disengaging from a hostile creature
spell.compontents: V, S, M (atrophied plant, your own shadow)
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You enter a shadow large enough to contain you and teleport yourself from you current location to any other shadowy spot within range of the spell. If can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating the distance and direction, so long as the destination is also a shadow large enough to contain you.
If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you take 4d6 force damage, and the spell fails to teleport you.
Stepping into the shadow is a Disengage, and you may Hide as a bonus action upon arrival.
You can cast this spell as an action on a creature you can touch, granting them the benefits of this spell, but casting the spell in this way causes you to lose your shadow until you complete a short rest.
Source: Rise of the Drow p. 325 (Third Party)
